title: How to Make Vegan Banana Muffins

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C, gas mark 4) as you grease 12 3-inch (75mm) muffin tins.
steps.description: You can use other sizes, but you may need to adjust the cooking time.

steps.headline: Peel and mash the bananas to produce about 1 1/2 cups of mashed banana, you'll need about three large bananas.
steps.description: Don't worry about this measure being exact; it can be to the nearest whole banana. Bananas for banana bread can be riper than the bananas that you would normally eat. Cut out any bad spots if you see them.

steps.headline: Put the mashed bananas into a medium mixing bowl.
Blend the sugar and the oil into the mashed bananas.
Blend 1-2 tablespoons of flaxseed with 3 tablespoons of water to produce a thick paste.
Add the flaxseed paste to the batter and mix it in.
Mix together the flours, the bran or oatmeal, the salt, the baking powder, and the baking soda in a separate bowl.
Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and stir just enough that everything is uniformly moist.
steps.description: It's fine if there are some lumps. Do not over mix.

steps.headline: Add up to 2 tablespoons of additional water if the batter is too thick.
Fold in the nuts gently, if you are using them, and any flavorings you wish to add.
Divide the batter into your 12 muffin tins.
steps.description: The muffins will rise, so only fill the tins 2/3 full.

steps.headline: Sprinkle a little extra oatmeal on top (optional).
Bake until the tops of the muffins are golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center of the muffins comes out clean.
steps.description: For 3" muffins, the baking time will be 20 to 25 minutes. Larger muffins will need to bake longer; smaller muffins will need to bake for less time.

steps.headline: Cool the muffins in the pans for about ten minutes, then remove them to finish cooling on a rack.

text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C, gas mark 4) as you grease 12 3-inch (75mm) muffin tins. You can use other sizes, but you may need to adjust the cooking time. Peel and mash the bananas to produce about 1 1/2 cups of mashed banana, you'll need about three large bananas. Don't worry about this measure being exact; it can be to the nearest whole banana. Bananas for banana bread can be riper than the bananas that you would normally eat. Cut out any bad spots if you see them. Put the mashed bananas into a medium mixing bowl.  Blend the sugar and the oil into the mashed bananas.  Blend 1-2 tablespoons of flaxseed with 3 tablespoons of water to produce a thick paste.  Add the flaxseed paste to the batter and mix it in.  Mix together the flours, the bran or oatmeal, the salt, the baking powder, and the baking soda in a separate bowl.  Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and stir just enough that everything is uniformly moist. It's fine if there are some lumps. Do not over mix. Add up to 2 tablespoons of additional water if the batter is too thick.  Fold in the nuts gently, if you are using them, and any flavorings you wish to add.  Divide the batter into your 12 muffin tins. The muffins will rise, so only fill the tins 2/3 full. Sprinkle a little extra oatmeal on top (optional).  Bake until the tops of the muffins are golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center of the muffins comes out clean. For 3" muffins, the baking time will be 20 to 25 minutes. Larger muffins will need to bake longer; smaller muffins will need to bake for less time. Cool the muffins in the pans for about ten minutes, then remove them to finish cooling on a rack.  Finished.
